New Records: The 2024 Yankees became the first team to have a game in which they blew a five-run lead, coughed up at least five unearned runs, stuffed three errors into the box score, and included both a balk and catcher's interference in the same game.
The 2024 Dodgers became the first team to win a World Series clincher after trailing by five runs.
The Dodgers' 7-6 win over the Yankees in Game 5 of the 2024 World Series was the craziest World Series clincher ever.
Walker Buehler became the second pitcher in World Series history to save a clinching game without having a previous big-league save.
Blake Treinen became the first reliever since Rollie Fingers to enter a World Series clincher in the sixth inning or earlier and then stick around to get the next 10 outs.
The Dodgers' 42-pitch outing by Blake Treinen in the 6th, 7th, and 8th innings was the most pitches thrown by a postseason saves leader in a World Series clincher since 1988.
Key Match Events: The Yankees blew a five-run lead in the fifth inning, allowing the Dodgers to tie the game.
Aaron Judge clanked a routine fly ball in center field, one of three errors made by the Yankees.
Anthony Volpe made an unfortunate throw to third on an attempted forceout, another error.
Cole forgot to cover first base on a spinning five-hopper, leading to a five-run inning for the Dodgers.
The Dodgers' two-run, eighth-inning rally put them ahead for good.
Walker Buehler closed out the game with a save, his first big-league save.
Blake Treinen threw 42 pitches in the 6th, 7th, and 8th innings, the most by a postseason saves leader in a World Series clincher since 1988.
Pre-Game Insights: Dodgers president of baseball operations Andrew Friedman said that the impossibility of the game was the best part of baseball.
Friedman stated that the games play out in all kinds of crazy ways, and this one was the crown jewel of that statement.
Post-Match Reflections: The Dodgers' Mookie Betts said that the game just epitomized their whole season, with all year they'd get dealt a blow, come back, get dealt a blow, come back.
Betts added that it's special to win the World Series in a game like this.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Yankees became the first team to hit back-to-back homers in the first inning of a World Series game.
The Dodgers imitated The Madison Bumgarner Game by winning a World Series clincher even though their starter didn't make it past the second inning.
Others: The game was so crazy that it's hard to summarize it in a few sentences.
The Dodgers' win marked the end of a 99-year drought since a team came from four runs back to win a World Series clincher.
